slokas.sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | संन्यासं कर्मणां कृष्ण पुनर्योगं च शंससि | यच्छ्रेय एतयोरेकं तन्मे ब्रूहि सुनिश्चितम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: arjuna uvāca | sannyāsaṁ karmaṇāṁ kṛṣhṇa punar yogaṁ ca śaṁsasi | yachchhreya etayoḥ erekaṁ tanme brūhi suṇishchitam
slokas.meaning: Arjuna said: O Krishna, you have praised the renunciation of action (Sannyasa) and also the path of selfless action (Karma Yoga). Please tell me which one of these is the better path for me to follow.

slokas.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | संन्यासः कर्मयोगश्च निःश्रेयसकरावुभौ | तयोस्तु कर्मसंन्यासात्कर्मयोगो विशिष्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhrī-bhagavān uvācha | sannyāsaḥ karma-yogaśh cha niḥśhreyasa-karāvubhau | tayos tu karma-sannyāsāt karma-yogo viśhiṣhyate
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Lord said: Both the path of renunciation and the path of selfless action lead to the highest good. But of the two, the path of selfless action is superior to the path of renunciation.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञेयः स नित्यसंन्यासी यो न द्वेष्टि न काङ्क्षति | निर्द्वन्द्वो हि महाबाहो सुखं बन्धात्प्रमुच्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: jñeyaḥ sa nitya-sannyāsī yo na dveṣhṭi na kāṅkṣhati | nirdvandvo hi mahā-bāho sukhaṁ bandhāt pramuchyate
slokas.meaning: Know that person to be a true renunciant who neither hates nor desires. One who is free from duality, O mighty-armed Arjuna, easily breaks free from bondage.

slokas.sanskrit: सांख्ययोगौ पृथग्बालाः प्रवदन्ति न पण्डिताः | एकमप्यास्थितः सम्यगुभयोर्विन्दते फलम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: sānkhya-yogau pṛithag bālāḥ pravadanti na paṇḍitāḥ | ekam apyāsthitaḥ samyag ubhayor vindate phalam
slokas.meaning: Only the ignorant speak of devotional service [karma-yoga] as being different from the analytical study of the material world [Sankhya]. Those who are actually learned say that he who applies himself well to one of these paths achieves the results of both.

slokas.sanskrit: यत्सांख्यैः प्राप्यते स्थानं तद्योगैरपि गम्यते | एकं सांख्यं च योगं च यः पश्यति स पश्यति ||
slokas.pronunciation: yat sāṅkhyaiḥ prāpyate sthānaṁ tad yogair api gamyate | ekaṁ sāṅkhyaṁ cha yogaṁ cha yaḥ paśhyati sa paśhyati
slokas.meaning: The destination reached by the followers of the path of philosophical speculation is also reached by the practitioners of selfless service. One who sees that both paths lead to the same goal, sees things as they are.

slokas.sanskrit: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः | योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: sannyāsas tu mahā-bāho duḥkham āptum ayogataḥ | yoga-yukto munir brahma nachireṇādhigachchhati
slokas.meaning: But renunciation of action is difficult to attain without performing action, O mighty-armed Arjuna. The sage who is engaged in the path of action with devotion attains Brahman quickly.

slokas.sanskrit: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः | सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yoga-yukto viśhuddhātmā vijitātmā jitendriyaḥ | sarva-bhūtātma-bhūtātmā kurvann api na lipyate
slokas.meaning: One who works in devotion, who is a pure soul, and who controls their mind and senses, is dear to everyone, and everyone is dear to them. Though always working, such a person is never entangled.

slokas.sanskrit: नैव किञ्चित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित् | पश्यञ्श्रृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपञ्श्वसन् ||
slokas.pronunciation: naiva kiñchit karomīti yukto manyeta tattva-vit | paśhyañ śhṛiṇvan spṛiśhañjighrann aśhnan gachchhan svapañśhvasan
slokas.meaning: A person in divine consciousness, although engaged in seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving about, sleeping, and breathing, always knows within themselves that they actually do nothing at all.

slokas.sanskrit: प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि | इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन् ||
slokas.pronunciation: pralapan visṛijan gṛihṇann unmiṣhan nimiṣhann api | indriyāṇīndriyārtheṣhu vartanta iti dhārayan
slokas.meaning: While speaking, evacuating, grasping, opening and closing the eyes, they always know that only the material senses are engaged with their objects and that they are separate from them.

slokas.sanskrit: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः | लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा ||
slokas.pronunciation: brahmaṇyādhāya karmāṇi saṅgaṁ tyaktvā karoti yaḥ | lipyate na sa pāpena padma-patram ivāmbhasā
slokas.meaning: One who performs their duty without attachment, surrendering the results unto the Supreme Lord, is unaffected by sinful action, as the lotus leaf is untouched by water.

slokas.sanskrit: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि | योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये ||
slokas.pronunciation: kāyena manasā buddhyā kevalair indriyair api | yoginaḥ karma kurvanti saṅgaṁ tyaktvātma-śhuddhaye
slokas.meaning: The yogis, abandoning attachment, perform actions with their body, mind, intellect, and senses, only for the purpose of self-purification.

slokas.sanskrit: युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम् | अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते ||
slokas.pronunciation: yuktaḥ karma-phalaṁ tyaktvā śhāntim āpnoti naiṣhṭhikīm | ayuktaḥ kāma-kāreṇa phale sakto nibadhyate
slokas.meaning: The steadily devoted soul attains unadulterated peace because they offer the result of all activities to Me; whereas one who is not in union with the Divine and is greedy for the fruits of their labor becomes entangled.

slokas.sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी | नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन् ||
slokas.pronunciation: sarva-karmāṇi manasā sannyasyāste sukhaṁ vaśhī | nava-dvāre pure dehī naiva kurvan na kārayan
slokas.meaning: When the embodied living being controls their nature and mentally renounces all actions, they reside happily in the city of nine gates [the body], neither working nor causing work to be done.

slokas.sanskrit: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः | न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते ||
slokas.pronunciation: na kartṛitvaṁ na karmāṇi lokasya sṛijati prabhuḥ | na karma-phala-saṁyogaṁ svabhāvas tu pravartate
slokas.meaning: The embodied spirit, master of the city of their body, does not create activities, nor does it induce people to act, nor does it create the fruits of action. All this is enacted by the modes of material nature.

slokas.sanskrit: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः | अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः ||
slokas.pronunciation: nādatte kasyachit pāpaṁ na chaiva sukṛitaṁ vibhuḥ | ajñānenāvṛitaṁ jñānaṁ tena muhyanti jantavaḥ
slokas.meaning: The Supreme Lord neither accepts anyone's sinful nor pious actions. Living beings are bewildered because their knowledge is covered by ignorance.

slokas.sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः | तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: jñānena tu tadajñānaṁ yeṣhāṁ nāśhitam ātmanaḥ | teṣhām āditya-vaj jñānaṁ prakāśhayati tat param
slokas.meaning: When, however, one is enlightened with the knowledge by which ignorance is destroyed, then their knowledge reveals everything, as the sun lights up everything in the daytime.

slokas.sanskrit: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः | गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः ||
slokas.pronunciation: tad-buddhayas tad-ātmānas tan-niṣhṭhās tat-parāyaṇāḥ | gachchhanty apunar-āvṛittiṁ jñāna-nirdhūta-kalmaṣhāḥ
slokas.meaning: When one's intelligence, mind, faith and refuge are all fixed in the Supreme, then one becomes fully cleansed of misgivings through complete knowledge and thus proceeds straight on the path of liberation.

slokas.sanskrit: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि | शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः ||
slokas.pronunciation: vidyā-vinaya-sampanne brāhmaṇe gavi hastini | śhuni chaiva śhva-pāke cha paṇḍitāḥ sama-darśhinaḥ
slokas.meaning: The humble sages, by virtue of true knowledge, see with equal vision a learned and gentle brāhmaṇa, a cow, an elephant, a dog and a dog-eater [outcaste].

slokas.sanskrit: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः | निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: ihaiva tair jitaḥ sargo yeṣhāṁ sāmye sthitaṁ manaḥ | nirdoṣhaṁ hi samaṁ brahma tasmād brahmaṇi te sthitāḥ
slokas.meaning: Those whose minds are established in sameness and equanimity have already conquered the conditions of birth and death. They are flawless like Brahman, and thus they are already situated in Brahman.

slokas.sanskrit: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम् | स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद्ब्रह्मणि स्थितः ||
slokas.pronunciation: na prahṛiṣhyet priyaṁ prāpya nodvijet prāpya chāpriyam | sthira-buddhir asammūḍho brahma-vid brahmaṇi sthitaḥ
slokas.meaning: A person who neither rejoices upon achieving something pleasant nor laments upon obtaining something unpleasant, who is self-intelligent, who is unbewildered, and who knows the science of God, is already situated in transcendence.

slokas.sanskrit: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम् | स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते ||
slokas.pronunciation: bāhya-sparśheṣhv-asaktātmā vindaty-ātmani yat sukham | sa brahma-yoga-yuktātmā sukham akṣhayam aśhnute
slokas.meaning: Such a person who is unattached to the external touch of things finds happiness in the Self. Being engaged in the yoga of Brahman, they attain endless happiness.

slokas.sanskrit: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते | आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः ||
slokas.pronunciation: ye hi sansparśha-jā bhogā duḥkha-yonaya eva te | ādy-antavantaḥ kaunteya na teṣhu ramate budhaḥ
slokas.meaning: The pleasures that arise from contact with the senses are sources of sorrow. They have a beginning and an end, O son of Kunti, and the wise do not delight in them.

slokas.sanskrit: शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात् | कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः ||
slokas.pronunciation: śhaknotīhaiva yaḥ soḍhuṁ prāk śharīra-vimokṣhaṇāt | kāma-krodhodbhavaṁ vegaṁ sa yuktaḥ sa sukhī naraḥ
slokas.meaning: One who is able to withstand the force of desire and anger even before leaving the body, is a yogi and a happy person.

slokas.sanskrit: योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः | स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: yo 'ntaḥ-sukho 'ntar-ārāmas tathāntar-jyotir eva yaḥ | sa yogī brahma-nirvāṇaṁ brahma-bhūto 'dhigachchhati
slokas.meaning: One who finds happiness within, who rejoices within, and who is illuminated within, such a yogi attains absolute freedom or Moksha, becoming one with the Divine.

slokas.sanskrit: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः | छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः ||
slokas.pronunciation: labhante brahma-nirvāṇam ṛiṣhayaḥ kṣhīṇa-kalmaṣhāḥ | chhinna-dvaidhā yatātmānaḥ sarva-bhūta-hite ratāḥ
slokas.meaning: Those sages whose sins have been destroyed, whose doubts are cut asunder, who are self-controlled, and who work for the welfare of all beings, attain liberation in the Supreme.

slokas.sanskrit: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम् | अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम् ||
slokas.pronunciation: kāma-krodha-viyuktānāṁ yatīnāṁ yata-chetasām | abhito brahma-nirvāṇaṁ vartate viditātmanām
slokas.meaning: For those who are free from desire and anger, who have controlled their thoughts, and who have realized the Self, liberation in Brahman exists in all directions.

slokas.sanskrit: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः | प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ ||
slokas.pronunciation: sparśhān kṛitvā bahir bāhyānśh chakṣhuśh chaivāntare bhruvoḥ | prāṇāpānau samau kṛitvā nāsābhyantara-chāriṇau
slokas.meaning: Shutting out all external sense objects, keeping the eyes and vision concentrated between the two eyebrows, suspending the inward and outward breaths within the nostrils.

slokas.sanskrit: यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः | विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः ||
slokas.pronunciation: yatendriya-mano-buddhir munir mokṣha-parāyaṇaḥ | vigatech-chhā-bhaya-krodho yaḥ sadā mukta eva saḥ
slokas.meaning: With the senses, mind, and intellect under control, having liberation as the supreme goal, free from desire, fear, and anger - such a sage is truly liberated forever.

slokas.sanskrit: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् | सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति ||
slokas.pronunciation: bhoktāraṁ yajña-tapasāṁ sarva-loka-maheśhvaram | suhṛidaṁ sarva-bhūtānāṁ jñātvā māṁ śhāntim ṛichchhati
slokas.meaning: Having known Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and austerities, the Supreme Lord of all the worlds, and the friend of all living beings, that person attains peace.
